website_summaries.verdict: This twisting jar opener is great for small and medium lids between 1.2 and 3.7 inches in diameter.
pros: Made of heavy stainless steel and solid hard plastic handle
Comes with a free, aluminum alloy bottle opener key chain
Suitable for jars with lids between 1.2 and 3.7 inches in diameter
Steel teeth on clamp grab lid and hold when you twist
cons: Too small for many larger jars

customer_reviews.title: Don’t order if you have issues with your hands.
customer_reviews.text: This product is of no use if you have carpal tunnel or arthritis. If you were able to get enough torque on the handle, it would require both hands to hold whatever you are trying to open. As it was, I was unable to open three out of three jars of homemade pint jars of pickles. I put it in a box to go to a charity. For me, it was useless. Perhaps someone with two strong hands, it may be.
customer_reviews.author: gemniwmn

customer_reviews.title: Not easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I find it quite difficult to set it in place to properly grip the jars. It often takes at least 3 to 4 tries to get a good grip and on several occasions the jars would slip and I was afraid I'd drop and break them on the counter or worse, my foot! I don't think this product is well designed. I may start looking for another one that works better and easier to use.
customer_reviews.author: I. Masduki

customer_reviews.title: Both my husband and I are in our 80's. ...
customer_reviews.text: Both my husband and I are in our 80's. \My hands are so weak that I can no longer open most jars. My husband can but he's not always available. I was skeptical of this little gadget but ordered it anyway. I still don't know just how it works BUT it does work. I will tell some friends about it as they have the same problem. Have only had it for a couple of weeks so can't speak to its lasting quality. Otherwise would have given it five stars.
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn A. Pate

customer_reviews.title: Simple - works!
customer_reviews.text: This replaced my dead RoboTwist battery-operated lid remover, which I loved, but I expected more than a year's sporadic use from it. I have arthritis in my hands and the simplest cap gives me trouble. This arrived in time to open a salad dressing container and a jar of jam. It seems a bit counter-intuitive, but I was surprised at how little effort it takes. I actually thought it wasn't working, removed it from the container and found the lid was loosened - on both the jam and dressing jars. It's mechanical so no batteries - a plus. I gave it 5 stars on durability, but time will tell and I will revisit if warranted. So far, I'm liking it.
customer_reviews.author: A. Henderson

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work.
customer_reviews.text: I have osteoarthritis in my hands and have pain at the base of my thumbs. This makes it difficult to open jars because one has to hold onto the jar with one hand in order to twist with the other. I was hoping this jar opener would allow me to open jars with less difficulty as it was advertised. I tried and still could not open the jar. It was too painful and, needless to say, I had to have someone else open the jar for me.
customer_reviews.author: Private

customer_reviews.title: If you got a broken shoulder I highly recommend this
customer_reviews.text: Worked like a charm after I figure couple things out. I have a broken shoulder and this creates a bit of a problem opening jars and other things. I was craving olives But I couldn't get the Lid to budge. I'm usually the one that people ask to open jars. I open the box and went to open it. I discovered that I couldn't open it with my right-hand. I wasn't sure if my broken left when would have the strength to open the jar but I switched hands and it opened like a breeze with no strain on the broken proximal humorous. I couldn't even tell I was trying to open the lid.Well worth the price for the ease.
customer_reviews.author: Philocrates

customer_reviews.title: Totally Buy Worthy
customer_reviews.text: Love - love - love this kitchen tool. I don’t have arthritis but I don’t have the hand strength to open a lot of containers. This tool makes it possible for me to independently open ANY size container from a pickle jar to a bottle of olive oil.
customer_reviews.author: MaryJane

customer_reviews.title: Too flimsy for real use
customer_reviews.text: This product is the definition of flimsy. I bought it to get open this one jar of jam that sat in a fridge for over too long, and had contents glue the lid to the jar. The tool punched a hole in the side of the lid, and disassembled itself, having rails spring off the center gear. They are not easy to put back.
customer_reviews.author: PAWEL VESELOV

customer_reviews.title: well made
customer_reviews.text: This product is nicely made and does what it says it will do. Because my hands are so arthritic it would be easier for me to use if the handle was bigger . I will end up adding foam or tape to the handle and it will work better for me. This review is not intended to discourage you from buying it. It's just my experience.
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: Has worked every time thus far.
customer_reviews.text: I use this gadget more often than expected. I find sitting the "teeth" on the lid a little tricky and I believe twisting in the opposite direction is what is confusing me but it works and only takes seconds to figure out. Regardless how tight the seal, this jar opener has not failed in opening a jar thus far. Happy to have it!
customer_reviews.author: D. Neilson

customer_reviews.title: Great Jar Opener
customer_reviews.text: I bought this jar opener because I can hardly close my hand and often suffer when trying to open jars. I read the reviews and saw that so many people gave this item an excellent review. So At this point I was willing to take a chance and buy one. Well I am glad I bought this jar opener. What a difference it made. It was so easy to use without straining my hand. Glad I bought it. Thanks Kichwit !
customer_reviews.author: Edward J. Corona

customer_reviews.title: We purchased five of the jar openers since we love the original openers (that have a wood handle and ...
customer_reviews.text: We purchased five of the jar openers since we love the original openers (that have a wood handle and have been useful and durable). The openers were given as Christmas presents and when we demonstrated one of them the handle stripped out without ever opening the jar. So the plastic handle was not a good replacement for the wood and also lacked the cross pin that the original opener had. Hopefully the other four actually worked and we don't get ridiculed next Christmas for bum presents.
customer_reviews.author: L B.

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality
customer_reviews.text: I have needed a jar opener for a long while now> I was worried about quality and remember my Mom had one like this 40 years ago that worked well and was very durable. I ordered based on the positive reviews and was not disappointed! This is very durable and helped me open a wide mouth salsa jar the 1st night I owned it. Very happy with purchase and so much easier to use than the electric ones.
customer_reviews.author: aklaw

customer_reviews.title: I have severe arthritis in my fingers and have a terrible time to open jars and there is no one ...
customer_reviews.text: I was scepticle about ordering this. I've bought a few lid openers in the past few months and none have helped me with larger sizes. I have severe arthritis in my fingers and have a terrible time to open jars and there is no one else here I can ask to help me. This jar opener actually opened the lid I have the hardest problem with. I've tried it on several jars now and it works each time. I did have a little trouble getting it to attach to the jar until I realized I was doing it wrong. It's actually easy to work. Since it is small it stores easily too.
customer_reviews.author: Peggy Darling

customer_reviews.title: Works on those tough jar lids
customer_reviews.text: I've generally never had to go beyond the rubber grip mats to open a jar, but recently a product we like alot comes sealed very tightly with a large lid that even water pump pliers made a mess of so tried this. It works well on small to large lids. Not something I use everyday but when I need it I don't have to worry about blowing out my elbow or finger joints anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Mr C

customer_reviews.title: !!!Get this gadget, It WORKS!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best invention ever! I’m older, but pretty strong. That said, I was really frustrated with jars that my husband, my neighbors, and my adult children couldn’t open. I kept a plumbing wrench in the kitchen for my power drinks! I didn’t have much hope for this “little twisty thing”, but I was surprised. It’s not only made well, IT WORKS!!! If I’d known how much easier opening jars would be, I would have paid more for it! (Shhhhh)
customer_reviews.author: Colorado-reader

customer_reviews.title: EASY TO USE, WORKS GREAT
customer_reviews.text: WOW! I wasn't sure what to expect when I bought this. I was pretty desperate because it can be so frustrating trying to open jars with tight lids. This device is amazing! It really works! I've used it on large jars with larger lids and small jars with small lids, and it works for all of them. The only thing is I can't vouch for how easy it would be for a person with arthritis, because I don't have arthritis. But for a regular person having trouble opening jars, it is definitely useful. Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: AWAKE NOW

customer_reviews.title: No Grip!
customer_reviews.text: The little can opener is about 2” and junky. The opener is so loose and has no grip to open anything. Unfortunately I waited too long and can’t return it
customer_reviews.author: Regina

customer_reviews.title: Kichwit Jar Opener
customer_reviews.text: It looked really cool...but it's not really functional. The details that are suppose to grip the containers cap\lid are too smooth to "bite" and so it spins loose more often than it grabs. I should have returned it...cause that is one of the features I love about buying from Amazon! But like I said earlier...it looked really cool. So it sits in my gadget drawer waiting for those times when it actually might come in handy!
customer_reviews.author: J. Cole

customer_reviews.title: Best Opener Ever!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best opener I've ever used in my life! I'm definitely gifting it to as many people as possible. Opposed to the other tools I've used in the past (and I've tried plenty), this one has opened every stubborn jar/bottle I've used it on, even ones I was sure wouldn't work. I especially love that it can handle any reasonably sized one due to the range of the clamp. Protip: Be sure to use this on a surface with grip, such as a silicone pad. If you used it directly on a counter with an especially stubborn jar, it'll probably just slip around.
customer_reviews.author: Chrissy

customer_reviews.title: You don’t have to fight to get those stubborn lids off of jars.
customer_reviews.text: I opened the box and thought ‘this will be a waste’. Well, how wrong was I??! It works great. My only complaint is that it will put some dents in the edges of lids, especially Ball canning type lids. It doesn’t seem to ruin them, but it dents it pretty seriously. Sturdier lids fare much better. I don’t think this is going to work on some lids on really large jars, but I have not had anything it hasn’t fit so far. Compact, was cheap and works. Pleased with this purchase. This does require two hands. One to turn device and one to keep a tight grip on the jar.
customer_reviews.author: J.A. Henson

customer_reviews.title: This was a gift so I am unable to review.
customer_reviews.text: I did try it on one thing before giving it to someone and it worked fine so I ordered one for myself. I find now that I am older I have trouble opening most things. I am excited about this product and trust it will work on everything i need help with. Once I receive the new order and use for awhile I will go back and review.
customer_reviews.author: JOHN C GRONBERG

customer_reviews.title: Ingenious gear teeth design tightens grip on lid automatically.
customer_reviews.text: The interlocking gear teeth ingeniously tighten the grip on the jar lid as the handle is turned. The more force (torque) that is applied, the tighter the grip. This device easily twisted off a large stubborn sauerkraut jar lid which other devices failed to fit or budge. The main problem was holding the heavy and slippery jar with the other hand. I had to lay the jar on its side on a soft towel in the sink in case of a spill. When the lid popped loose, I quickly set the jar upright to prevent the contents from leaking out.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Jarvis

customer_reviews.title: Good for arthritic hands
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my dad because he said his arthritis had been affecting his thumb strength and he wasn't able to grip things like he used to. I was skeptical and he's picky about things, but he gave it his approval. So for the price, I'd say this is worth it. Even if it doesn't open every jar, it seems like it works on enough of them to give it a good solid thumbs up. I would definitely recommend it, especially for someone who doesn't have a strong grip, regardless of the reasons.
customer_reviews.author: Miss PeabodiTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Wow, it saved my life!
customer_reviews.text: Finally able to open these stubborn jars! Easy to use. Opened in 2 seconds with little energy.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy

customer_reviews.title: Ideal For Smaller Caps
customer_reviews.text: The Kichwit lid opener is the only one that enables me to open small bottle caps, like on the one-liter bottles of fresh grapefruit juice, without spilling it or getting a hernia. The gripper mechanism is all metal so nothing to wear out. The actual gripping surfaces are smooth and look like they should slip instead of grip, but so far they have done the job with no problems. The bonus opener for bottles and pull-tab tops is very handy as well. I have several jar openers and will try to learn how to upload photos ASAP.
customer_reviews.author: MysteryAuthor

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommended!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent! Have been using silicone type pads or cones for years to try to grab and turn covers on unopened jars. This device takes just two seconds to open a lid, needs almost no effort, and requires only turning, not squeezing. Works equally well for jars with cold lids that were in the refrigerator. Probably also great for people with arthritis or similar. Can't believe I've been struggling all these years with those silicone pads. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: First reliable jar opener
customer_reviews.text: I have tried several types of jar openers but this is the first one that I was able to use without any problems. It grips the lid firmly enough to remove it. It might not be able to fit a very large jar lid but it has fit the jars I have used it on. As with most jar openers, you still need to keep a firm grip on the jar while removing the lid. The bonus bottle opener was a nice add-on but I haven't had a chance to use it. If you have trouble with your hands like me, it is a good kitchen tool to have around.
customer_reviews.author: S. HarperTop Contributor: Fountain Pens

customer_reviews.title: Often Slips
customer_reviews.text: The concept is good, but the appliance lacks sufficient grip to hold onto jar lids. The screw-tight apparatus is somewhat loose so it moves in and out when I begin to turn the white handbar. I do not recommend it for anyone who is even slightly arthritic or coexisting with carpal tunnel.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It does a very poor job opening small lids
customer_reviews.text: It does a very poor job opening small lids, like on water bottles. I may have opened one bottle out of 10. Works a little better on larger lids. Very difficult to hold bottle and device, then twist the handle. I bought it for my father, who found it much more difficult to coordinate
customer_reviews.author: Nuala

customer_reviews.title: Great jar opener
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this jar opener for my mother, who has very bad arthritis and no grip at all. I think this is a great jar opener because I can open jars with no effort at all. Unfortunately, my mother still cannot open jars with this product. I've trying helping her to use it, but because she has a weak grip and isn't very strong, she just cannot turn the opener to open jars. Because it's so easy for me to use, I'm still giving it 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: SrfrGrl

customer_reviews.title: Good enough.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item because I’d lost the one that had belonged to my parents since I was a child (I’m 74 years old now!). This one works fine, but clearly isn’t quite as durable as that one; I can’t imagine it lasting 70 years! Nor does it open quite as wide as my parents’ did, but I think opens widely enough. One suggestion: I don’t have arthritis; just sometimes need help opening jars with very tight lids. You may lose potential buyers by designating it for arthritis.
customer_reviews.author: Anne F. Hines

customer_reviews.title: Bottle/Jar opener with bad grip
customer_reviews.text: Mechanically it works absolutely perfect. I found the bottle/jar grips a little disappointing. I would have thought they should have had some type of roughness or something that would help them to grip a slick surface. NO! And not only is the surface on the grips smooth, they barely curve around a full 90 degrees to make full contact with the jar lid. The result of this is that the opener is a little difficult to get to grab the lid and securely hold it. It keeps wanting to pop off the lid. It's pretty nice but with only a little extra thought it could have been Awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Algrim

customer_reviews.title: useful tool for arthritic hands
customer_reviews.text: A very simple, useful tool for arthritic hands. It's a little difficult for my hands to hold it steady until it grips, but once it does, it opens things very easily. I tried a battery-driven opener and took it back to the store. it was junk. Ordered this one and I'm well-pleased. Simple is best.
customer_reviews.author: Don Carriker

customer_reviews.title: amazing little device
customer_reviews.text: amazing little device. I am 68 and opening out some of these jars would be hard for the hulk. this jar opens the hardest jar in seconds.
customer_reviews.author: steve allison

customer_reviews.title: Small but Mighty
customer_reviews.text: Hubby and I have tried several tools to assist in opening vacuum sealed jars and continued to struggle. This tool does not extend wide enough for all jars (say a dill pickle jar), but worked wonderfully tonight for me when I had to open a jar of candied pecans. Just set it on the jar lid, tighten the hold, then turn the handle. No strength necessary. Still smiling.
customer_reviews.author: CW

customer_reviews.title: Works well, easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this jar opener because I have painful arthritis in my wrist and was looking for an aid to open jars and screw-top bottles. I read reviews of this and other products like strap wrenches and this seemed a good mix of function and price. It works well so far. I had to wait to use it until I bought a bottle of apple juice and it worked perfectly. It has an adjustable gripper that opens or closes to fit the jar lid or bottle top and takes little turning strength to break the seal. I would recommend it without hesitation.
customer_reviews.author: Hanover67

customer_reviews.title: This was purchased as a replacement for a similar tool ...
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased as a replacement for a similar tool that was well used and had become rusted out with time and cleaning.That old one had never failed to accomplish its one task. The new one is inferior. It does not grip tightly and has not once succeeded in opening anything! Hang on to your old stuff!!
customer_reviews.author: Genevieve Kazdin

customer_reviews.title: it does a very good job with smaller items and I'm pleased with the ...
customer_reviews.text: The product works well as described but for me it isn't big enough. many of the jars that I need to open are much larger than this item supports. it does a very good job with smaller items and I'm pleased with the company, delivery etc. I just don't have much need for opening smaller sized jars.
customer_reviews.author: Russ

customer_reviews.title: GREAT TOOL - Everyone should have one
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because it looked like a simple, easy-to-use design for my sore hand. I was right. It makes opening things a breeze. You can open something as small as a bottle of carbonated soda to something as big as a huge jar of pickles with ease. I recommend this product highly. It would work really well for arthritis sufferers.
customer_reviews.author: Joanie Cameron

customer_reviews.title: Works really well!
customer_reviews.text: I use it for very tightly capped cold-pressed juice bottles and it works like a charm, Not sure how this company caps their juice but sometimes NOTHING will pry the bottles open. I thought I just lacked strength so I borrowed a friend's 20-something son and he even struggled with it. I've bought several different brands and styles and this one wins. Sadly it was lost in a move and am now buying another!
customer_reviews.author: A. Meer

customer_reviews.title: Empty "PRIME" Package
customer_reviews.text: Just received an "EMPTY" package from Amazon> WTH! It was going to be just a little stocking stuffer! An empty package, from Amazon! Sealed! Called Customer Support and got the customary "We Apologize" but I am stricken by this seemingly minor purchase! I always considered Amazon to be 99.99% effective in handling my orders? Receiving an empty package, no matter how inexpensive the item is, is depressing and intolerable! BAH HUMBUG!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: ED

customer_reviews.title: Works Beautifully
customer_reviews.text: The product works perfectly for aging hands to be able to open jars easily. The rubber hand grippers that are easily found just do not work well with hands that are older or arthritic. The operation is simple. Only down side is that it is shipped directly from China so the boat takes forever it feels like. Someone needs to stock it here in the States so that it ships the same day on a much tighter delivery line than five weeks.
customer_reviews.author: gardenfriend

customer_reviews.title: Great for single use lids terrible for everything else
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely hated this and returned it after trying it on three different jars. It's difficult to use, and it absolutely destroys the lids. I have very weak wrists so I can't put jar lids on very tight to begin with, but this absolutely shreds the lids making it so they don't even screw on right after just the first use. Sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: NaNa Na NaNa

customer_reviews.title: The design is good but the product did not work for me possibly ...
customer_reviews.text: The design is good but the product did not work for me possibly being a defective item. Difficult to regulate diameter as the steel teeth got stuck and were not moving, then unable to clamp securely over the jar lid, therefore unable to twist and unable to open.
customer_reviews.author: MT

customer_reviews.title: Hard to figure out how this thing works
customer_reviews.text: I should have sent it back, but kept it. Quite cumbersome. I've found another that works like a charm!
customer_reviews.author: CG Sassy 1

customer_reviews.title: From small to large
customer_reviews.text: This is easier than the handheld multiple size pinch styles. My wife has problems opening many items and this allows her to do so without assistance. I too have trouble opening some items and I like the idea that this fits multiple size lids without having to change devices. In short, I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: As I See It

customer_reviews.title: Good product, has limitations
customer_reviews.text: Overall I am satisfied with this product. As I have gotten able, my arthritis makes it difficult for me to open some jars. This gadget works for me on many jars but not all. Maybe not the products fault, but I am still unable to exert enough pressure to get some open. For the most part, this gadget is helpful to me though.
customer_reviews.author: KTucker

customer_reviews.title: does not work easily
customer_reviews.text: I tried to use this on my own following directions, even asked husband. It was a little bit easier for him because of strong hands. When I tried myself again it skinned my knuckles.
customer_reviews.author: customer

customer_reviews.title: Looks good but doesn't work.
customer_reviews.text: It simply doesn't work. There is no grip. Apparently years ago they did work. This gadget is apparently like it but not the same. I see the lack of grip as the main fault. The grabber is shiny, slippery metal. It simply doesn't connect nor open anything. An adjustible wrench works for me. Returning this fancy piece of trash.
customer_reviews.author: wordlings

customer_reviews.title: Senior person much have
customer_reviews.text: I Have had this for several months now. I have not found any jars it can not open. I prefer glass jars over cans for the food I purchase. That was a problem at my age 76 before getting this device. Hay kids, this is a great gift to Grandparents. And you may want one for mom when you see how well it works.
customer_reviews.author: San Antonio Pete

customer_reviews.title: really works
customer_reviews.text: As I get into my 70's, opening jar lids becomes a somewhat macho challenge that I always attempt to triumph at unaided. I would say 50% of the time I succeed and am then most pleased with myself. But I recently suffered defeat once too often and so ordered three different openers from this site. Of the three this is the one I prefer. It has never not worked.
customer_reviews.author: jjmmkk

customer_reviews.title: Needed for our arthritic hands! All the other jar lid "helpers" require much more effort.
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Just what we needed for our arthritic hands! All the other jar lid "helpers" require much more effort. Bringing the fingers back towards the palm gives us much more leverage, almost painlessly, compared to the solutions which required us to spread our fingers out wider, like the rubber grippers.
customer_reviews.author: SocraticMethod

customer_reviews.title: Jelly and spaghetti jars are no longer an annoying hassle to open
customer_reviews.text: Jelly and spaghetti jars are no longer an annoying hassle to open. Seriously, I've nearly chopped off my thumb trying to open a jar of marinara sauce with a butcher so if someone has slow and inept as me can utilize this gadget, anyone can. Major kudos from me and my two intact thumbs.
customer_reviews.author: Jee W

customer_reviews.title: Very handy jar opener, especially for vacuum packed jelly jars
customer_reviews.text: It's fast. It's efficient. It's especially good to use in the early morning when finger dexterity and coordination aren't at their best. It's also wonderful for those in my household that lack the firm hand strength that I have. As an added bonus, you can use it even when your hands are totally wet or covered with cooking oil.
customer_reviews.author: John Veneruso

customer_reviews.title: Great for old people
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I started having trouble opening jars. For some reason, tomato based things are the worst. Using this opening my wife can easily open ANYTHING. We used to pound jars not he floor and run them under hot water. With this little gem none of that is necessary. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Harrop

customer_reviews.title: FINALLY!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: FINALLY! A jar opener that actually does it's job! I have arthritic hands and opening jars was a nightmare. I tried other new products. They didn't work and hurt my hands. Went back to banging the jar lids with a can opener to break the seal. Then, I saw this product on Amazon. It is exactly the same as the one my mother used in the 50's. She had arthritis too. I bought it and it pops open those jars with one brief twist. Sometimes you just can't improve certain products. Compact and fits neatly in a kitchen drawer. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: VICTORIA

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: I have arthritis & was able to use this product quite comfortably! It is always a good idea to run the stubborn jar lids under hot water for a few minutes before trying to open. Just an FYI
customer_reviews.author: SC

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t open large jars
customer_reviews.text: I had broken my left wrist and had surgery and could not open jars. This jar opener does help although I have to put it in the jar between my feet! The jar opener does not open large jar covers. The largest cover it will open is a wide mouth mason jar cover and it slips on the plastic covers. It’s pretty good. Not wonderful
customer_reviews.author: maryelleninhawaii

customer_reviews.title: Best on the market
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I have a similar opener that I inherited from my mother's kitchen. It was bought by her or my father either in the twenties or the thirties. I use it still on a regular basis. Yours is nearly identical to it. I bought yours to give as a a present to my brother-in-law. It is, without question, the very best jar opener on the market; none other even comes close to yours.
customer_reviews.author: B. Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Very handy kitchen aid
customer_reviews.text: I bought this jar opener to help my arthritic fingers, and it works like a charm. I find it very easy to use on lids of all kinds, and its small size makes it easy to store in an easily-accessible drawer. The nicest part is that it takes away a major frustration when prepping meals. I'd buy it again, and have recommended it to friends.
customer_reviews.author: Cecilia P

customer_reviews.title: It didn't work for me
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't turn and hold at the same time. It didn't work for me. I gave it away
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn

customer_reviews.title: You must pick your battles
customer_reviews.text: The idea is good. The execution is not. Wife and daughter loved it when they saw it, but it only worked on certain lids. Sometimes the jar/bottle needed to be held by another person. Often the gripping surfaces just slipped no matter what. It isn't used anymore here.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I purchased for my elderly parents, and tested it before I gave it to them. I was so impressed I bought one for myself. It is very easy to use, and I have not experienced any quality issues. It makes opening lids from jars or bottles very easy.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Graham

customer_reviews.title: Wow..... It really works.
customer_reviews.text: I thought it might be like any other so called jar opener, but was I wrong! This thing is so easy to use and very handy. If you have weak hands then this is what you need. I know they've been around a long time, but I'm just now discovering it. Don't wait.....
customer_reviews.author: Restfornow

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve got an arthritis like condition that causes pain in my hands. Opening jars had become my least favorite thing to do and I was looking at a much more expensive device. I gave this a try and got much more than I expected. It’s easy to use, performs perfectly and seems sturdy. If that changes I’ll update the review.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Turnbough

customer_reviews.title: Finally a jar opener that works
customer_reviews.text: I don't open a lot of jars but when I need to it is nice to have a product that works. This is my third jar opener. I don't have arthritis in my hands but they are weak. So far I am able to open a jar easily. I haven't used it on over sized lids yet though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I have been looking for this product
customer_reviews.text: My Mom had one of these devices back in the '50s so I had been looking for one myself. I'm glad I found it. I have not had it long so I have only used it once but it worked very well as I anticipated. The original handle was wooden painted a light green and was peeling but this one is solid plastic and shouldn't have that problem.
customer_reviews.author: Russ R.

customer_reviews.title: Kitchwit is a winner!
customer_reviews.text: This is a welcome change from the rubberized lid grippers. I found it very easy to use, even with arthritic hands. The bottle opening tool that was included with order will come in handy, too. Haven't had a need to use it yet, but am sure that it will be put to good use in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Sweet Pea

customer_reviews.title: It works, but not for extra large jars
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping it would be like the device I used in the 70's which expanded to a wide mouth jar. This one doesn't expand much farther than in the picture. It works, I just was hoping for something more.
customer_reviews.author: kat.strauch

customer_reviews.title: It does not work
customer_reviews.text: The jar opener does get enough grip on the sides of the lid to provide the torque needed to open the jar. It is pretty useless.
customer_reviews.author: Kalavinka

customer_reviews.title: It works, but makes dent on the lid
customer_reviews.text: A lot of times I was struggling to open a jar because it is too tight. So I decided to buy a jar opening tool. This one was my first attempt. It basically did the job. But it seems to have a flaw - it will cause damage to the lid in my experience. Because of that, I’ll stay neutral on this one. This is a working product but it still needs improvement
customer_reviews.author: Aimee

customer_reviews.title: Gave it to my mom
customer_reviews.text: My mom was looking for one of these everywhere. I found one on Amazon and got it for her for Christmas. She used it once and it has sat in her drawer ever since. I asked her how she likes it she says its great. I don't know what to tell y'all.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm on many sized bottles
customer_reviews.text: Easy and intuitive to use. Easy on arthritic hands. Looks durable. I got some Dycem ("Dycem Non-Slip Material Roll, Blue, 8" X 3.25 ft") this lovely tacky material. I cut a piece a little larger than the size of the jars I deal with. Put the jar on the Dycem. Put the jar opener on top of the jar and twist. I can do it one-handed I don't have to squeeze the jar with the other hand. Yeah!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Jar Opening Made Easy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this opener for my Mom because she has arthritic hands. She loves it! Since that purchase I bought two more...one for my aunt and one for myself. Everyone who has any difficulty opening a jar should have one of these!
customer_reviews.author: Thia

customer_reviews.title: A complete waste of time and money.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this device because decades ago as a child we had that same type of tool to open jars. The difference is that all those years ago that tool opened jars. I've had this item for weeks and still haven't been able to open a jar with it.
customer_reviews.author: Theodore Ressler

customer_reviews.title: Mom Was Right
customer_reviews.text: My mother always had one just like it in her house. Over the years, I tried several other types but over the years as arthritis and Dupuytrens weakened my hands, the other stuff wasn't working for me any more. So, I saw an ad for this and remembered my mom. Yup. It works great! She was right. (as usual).
customer_reviews.author: BarbraGenie

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended! Works as advertised!
customer_reviews.text: I once had an oil filter remover for my car that worked the same way and loved it. We decided to try this item to see if it compared. Happy to say my wife and I love it! Highly recommended as a great gift to someone who has a hard time opening jars. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Z

customer_reviews.title: Works well and very affordable!
customer_reviews.text: I have had arthritis in my hands for about 25 years. I had been able to open jars with a rubber square up until recently. I saw this jar opener advertised and thought I would give it a try. It works extremely well. I actually was able to finally open a jar of salsa which I had bought a couple of months ago. The little bottle opener also works on the jar by lifting it up slightly and allowing some air in the jar and then opens easily. It was very affordable too!
customer_reviews.author: historicalficlover

customer_reviews.title: This thing is really a great addition to our kitchen implements drawer
customer_reviews.text: This is a gadget I have been waiting for all my adult life! Finally, I don't have to bang jar lids on the floor hoping that will make them easier to open! This thing is really a great addition to our kitchen implements drawer! Everybody should have one.
customer_reviews.author: anna noplace

customer_reviews.title: USELESS--DOESN'T WORK AT ALL
customer_reviews.text: THIS PRODUCT IS COMPLETELY USELESS. THE BAR THAT IS SUPPOSED TO GRIP A LID SLIPS AND DOES NOT GRIP AT ALL. I TRIED A GRIP-PAD ON THE LID TO GIVE TRACTION, BUT IT DIDN'T WORK. A USELESS PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.author: WV2VT

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I have arthritis in my hands and opening jars and bottles is a real pain, literally. This jar opener is the answer. It's easy to put on the jar. It fits lots of sizes because it's easily adjusted, and it takes almost no effort to twist. I recommend it to anyone with arthritis and if you need a gift for someone who has problems opening jars get them this.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Have used ONCE!!
customer_reviews.text: Have only used it once so far (these reviews come WAY TOO SOON!!), but was very satisfied with it the one time I used it. Am looking forward to using it again soon. BTW, I'm the only person in my household. Requested responses when you've had the product one day may work for large families, but are annoying for a single person.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Howard

customer_reviews.title: The best I've found so far.
customer_reviews.text: WORKS. Easy to use. Refer to dimensions, this isn't for large jars, but, in my opinion, it is very worth having. Takes up little storage space. Tried many types of jar openers and this is the only one I'm holding on to. Have told friends and family about it. I'm in my 40's and had an injury to my right hand many years ago that leaves it weak and cramping; pain increases when I try to twist off lids. I recommend purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: Francine

customer_reviews.title: Does what it is intended to do
customer_reviews.text: The engineers should have specified some rubber or silicone-like substance on the "grippers." It is difficult to get the device properly seated and the ends don't grip the lid well but rather they prefer to slide on the lid. Once a firm grip is finally established, though, it works just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Scorpio1155

customer_reviews.title: A Blessing for me...
customer_reviews.text: This jar opener has been a blessing for me. I have arthritis in my hands and most of my fingers and don’t have much strength in them. This opener makes opening jars so much easier for me.
customer_reviews.author: betfrs

customer_reviews.title: Total waste of money
customer_reviews.text: The thing slips and is awkward to use. Tried it on several different lid sizes and materials...complete bust. Don’t waste your money. I wasn’t going to give it any stars but couldn’t submit without some rating.
customer_reviews.author: penelope misner

customer_reviews.title: Very useful tool
customer_reviews.text: Have never thought that I would need a jar opener until now. Since I got the trigger finger and problem with my wrist, I started having troubles of opening jars. And luckily found this small tool. It’s so easy to use and really does its job. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Broke After Five Months
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine until month five, then broke. Originally gave one star, but Kichwit customer service contacted me to offer a free replacement. So I am increasing to four stars based on excellent customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Wahoo60s

customer_reviews.title: jar opener
customer_reviews.text: I love love love my jar opener. I have LUPUS so sometimes, MOST-TIMES i can't open jars or medicine bottles and need that help. This jar opener is the first one i have found that really helps open items. It is super easy to use and i love it.
customer_reviews.author: Dianne H.

customer_reviews.title: Only works on large lids, no grip.
customer_reviews.text: Won’t work for lids under 1.5” across because the gripping contact area is smooth and not serrated which makes it so it slips off the lid easily. If it had this it would be a great item but as it is, not worth the effort.
customer_reviews.author: Scotty P.

customer_reviews.title: WORKS EXACTLY AS DESCRIBED
customer_reviews.text: This is a GREAT little tool for opening small jars & bottles. I wish they sold one for bigger size jars & bottles. That does not mean that I don't recommend this tool, because I do.
customer_reviews.author: jwm1941.dec

customer_reviews.title: This is the best jar opener that I have had in a long ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the best jar opener that I have had in a long time. I have tried several different brands of the battery operated jar opener and they would only work for a short time or not work at all. I do have an electric jar opener that will open larger jars that i use for the bigger items. For the small jars this works fine.
customer_reviews.author: nancypik

customer_reviews.title: Does the job just fine
customer_reviews.text: A little hard to get it started on some small and smooth lids but some finagling results in an easy open. I find myself reaching for this opener over all the other ones in our junk drawer.
customer_reviews.author: Viajero

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and it works on everything!
customer_reviews.text: Had one from fifty years ago. Told my daughter in law we would will it to her. Now we just got her a brand new one for her. I didn't think this made these anymore. The best opener ever! Easy to use, fits everything. I have bad thumbs and arthritis. Thank you for bringing this opener back!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Pangburn

customer_reviews.title: It did not work for me.  As for the free item, I now have three
customer_reviews.text: I only have one jar that I could use help opening every two weeks. While its size fits under this opener, I was not able to open It with this item. Maybe it would work for a man. The free item is garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Gables

customer_reviews.title: it's nice
customer_reviews.text: it is a nice little opener, and it works. This is what Intuitive engineering is supposed to mean. Just put it on the jar lid and as you unscrew the lid the opener self adjusts to the correct size. ... Sweet.
customer_reviews.author: mel

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Can be difficult to use if you have Arthritis! It takes a lot of strength to use this!
customer_reviews.author: les53

customer_reviews.title: Works well on caps large to small
customer_reviews.text: Works very well on all sizes of lids that I have tried so far, small to large. I had the type that was sort of scissors-shaped, with handles that extended to the side. Worked well also, but one of the handles eventually broke off and I replaced it with this one. I prefer this one as it is more compact in my gadget drawer, and works just as well. Seems to be a pretty sturdy device.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It Works
customer_reviews.text: This is more than another kitchen gadget; it's a big help. I bought one for my mom and one for myself, and it really does work. As long as you can get a good grip on the bottom of the jar, it takes very little effort to get most lids open with this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Kichwit Jar Opener Stainless Steel, Bottle Opener Keychain Included
feature_bullets: ✔ RUST RESISTANT JAR OPENER. This jar opener is made of heavy stainless steel and solid hard plastic handle that will last and not rust. Comes with a free bottle opener key chain that's made of aluminium alloy, which is a bonus.
✔ STURDY AND DURABLE. Suitable for jars with lids between 1” to 3.7” diameter. The jar opener is made of sturdy material and super durable.
✔ EASY TO TWIST. The stainless steel teeth on the clamp grab the edge of the stubborn lid tightly and hold it the entire time you are twisting. Easily opens most jars with a simple twist!
✔ SWEET GIFT FOR THOSE WITH ARTHRITIS HANDS. With this arthritis jar opener, you will no longer have to struggle to open lids any more! Perfect for seniors and those with arthritic hands.
✔ COMPACT KITCHEN TOOL. This jar opener is easy to store and takes up small space in your kitchen drawer. Definitely a must-have kitchen tool!

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars3,359 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
